author: Special Correspondent
text:
Power generation in the first reactor of Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project (KKNPP) resumed on Monday after the leak in the secondary circuit tube carrying steam was rectified.

Following the leak of steam in the secondary circuit tube, electricity generation in the reactor was stopped on February 16 evening. As the problem was rectified, power generation resumed at 8.54 a.m. on Monday and the quantum was gradually increased to 300 MWe in the evening.

Following the 7-month-long maintenance carried out in the reactor and the allied systems following the scheduled annual fuel outage, the reactor started generating power on January 30.
title: Power generation resumes at KKNPP
